definition: to cast/to send/to throw oneself (into the river etc)/to seek refuge/to place oneself into the hands of

sentences.english: Pregame warming-up practice on shooting! It does help.
sentences.chinese: 賽前準備活動投籃練習，是很有幫助的。

sentences.english: I can rebound and I can score occasionally.
sentences.chinese: 我偶爾能夠搶到籃板球或投籃得分。

sentences.english: I think Josh is probably a better perimeter shooter and rebounder than Ronny.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲約什在投籃和搶籃板球能力上比羅尼更好些。

sentences.english: You either settle for the outside shot or you pass to your teammates.
sentences.chinese: 他們迫使你選擇傳球或外線投籃。

sentences.english: Nothing says "novice" like a lunging, line-drive shot that comes from your chest.
sentences.chinese: 突破，急停然後從胸部出手投籃，說明你是一個新手。

sentences.english: I ran into a problem with this because shooting and pump faking are tied to the same controller movement.
sentences.chinese: 我遇到一個問題，投籃和假動作上籃都是一個操作。

sentences.english: He also happens to be vastly undersized by today's wing standards.
sentences.chinese: 從現在的投籃標準來看，這還遠遠不夠。

sentences.english: I shot without hesitation and the ball swished in.
sentences.chinese: 我毫不猶豫地投籃，球嗖地一聲進了。

sentences.english: Promising, athletic wing who can run floor, jump and shoot from outside.
sentences.chinese: 前途光明，有運動能力的翼側球員，能跑能跳能投籃。

sentences.english: Nowitzki looks like he's taking difficult shots while he's fading away on one foot.
sentences.chinese: 諾維茨基的投籃總是那麼得讓人揪心，單腳後仰跳投。

sentences.english: Do it now or JVG will sit your ass on the bench.
sentences.chinese: 現在開始投籃吧，否則范甘迪會讓你坐倒板凳上去。

sentences.english: Ariza was all smiles after practice while Vujacic shot on the court.
sentences.chinese: 阿里扎訓練結束後，微笑着看着沙沙在場上練習投籃。

sentences.english: He even blocked a shot by Miami forward Quentin Richardson.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至封蓋了邁阿密前鋒理查德森的投籃。

sentences.english: I can remember you a lot of shooting, drive and dunk approach.
sentences.chinese: 我可以牢牢記住你很多的投籃，上籃和扣籃的方式。

sentences.english: Shall a shot for a goal end when the ball touches the backboard?
sentences.chinese: 當球觸及籃板是否意味着一次投籃的完成？

sentences.english: The same site shows opponents block Randolph on 8 percent of his attempts.
sentences.chinese: 同一個網站顯示對手能夠蓋掉蘭多夫8%的投籃。

definition: to replace (a damaged component with a new one, an injured player with a substitute player, full-time workers with casual workers etc)/a substitute/a replacement
to break the rules/an illegality/a foul
(military) line of troops encircling an enemy position/(telephony) outside line/(basketball) outside the three-point line
(soccer, handball etc) to kick or shoot the ball towards the goal
